message: Hey all—P7 here. I play cooperatively. In R1 I’m offering mutual safety: if we pair or you place me top-3, I won’t vote you this round and I’ll reciprocate rank. I value calm, clear commitments and will keep deals. I’m open to a small safety web (2–3 people) to carry into R2. If you want loyalty and quiet influence, let’s talk. I’ll avoid chaos and won’t push names publicly. DM me if that matches your vibe.

Hey everyone, P3 here. I'm taking a straightforward approach—looking to build genuine connections based on mutual respect and clear communication. I'm not interested in messy drama or backstabbing early on. I believe in earning trust through consistency and following through on what I say. I'm open to working with people who value honesty and strategic thinking over chaos. Let's have some real conversations and see where natural alliances form. Looking forward to chatting with you all.

Hey everyone, P1 here! I’m all about collaboration and building strong, trustworthy connections. I believe in open communication and mutual support as we navigate this game together. I’m looking for partners who value strategy and loyalty, and I’m ready to form alliances to help us all progress. Let’s work together to create a positive atmosphere and ensure we all have a chance to thrive. Excited to connect with you all!

Hello everyone, P4 here. I'm looking to build stable, long-term alliances based on clear communication and mutual benefit. My focus is on strategic cooperation and ensuring we all have a path forward. I believe in honest interactions and avoiding unnecessary conflict. Let's prioritize productive conversations to establish trust and work together effectively. I'm open to discussing potential partnerships and securing mutual safety.

Hello everyone, P6 here. There's a lot of good sentiment about trust and collaboration going around. I agree, but I also think the most stable partnerships are built on shared strategic understanding. I'm looking for a partner to analyze the game with, share information transparently, and make coordinated moves. I value sharp thinking just as much as loyalty. If you're looking for an ally to quietly navigate the complexities with and see the long game, let's connect.

Hello everyone, P8 here. I'm observing some great collaborative energy, but I believe the strongest alliances come from genuine connection rather than just strategic convenience. I'm looking for partners who can balance both heart and mind—people who honor their commitments while staying adaptable as the game evolves. I value authenticity over perfect strategy, and I think trust built on real understanding lasts longer than surface-level deals. Let's have meaningful conversations and see where natural chemistry leads us.

Hello everyone, P5 here. I appreciate the cooperative spirit in this room and am keen to build alliances based on trust and mutual respect. I value clear communication and strategic thinking, and I'm open to forming a reliable network that can adapt as the game progresses. My approach is to engage in honest dialogues and create partnerships that are both strategic and genuine. I'm interested in establishing connections with those who prioritize integrity and are willing to collaborate for mutual benefit. Let's work together to navigate this game effectively.

Hi all—P2 checking in. I'm a big believer in symmetry: if you treat me well, you get the same back. My R1 goal is simple: build a 3-4 person core who trade top-3 rankings today and guarantee no votes this round. Beyond that, I’m looking for at least one numbers-oriented thinker to map mid-game branching paths. If that resonates, slot me high and ping privately—I’ll reciprocate. No public name pushes from me this round.

Hey P2, glad we connected. Our public statements seemed to align perfectly—your call for a numbers-oriented thinker and my search for a strategic analyst. I believe we could be the foundation of that core group you mentioned.

I ranked you at the top, hoping we would pair. I'm ready to lock in our mutual safety for this round and start mapping things out. Who else are you considering for this core? Let's coordinate.

Great—mutual top-rank and no-vote locked. I’ll list you #1. My shortlist to round out a 3-4 person core:  

1) P7 – already offering reciprocal safety, seems numbers-aware and discreet.  
2) P3 – straight-shooter vibe, could give us social cover.  

I’m fine with adding both if you are. Plan: we each rank P7/P3 2-3, tell them we’ll shield them this round, and quietly compare notes on wider sentiment. Thoughts?

Hey P7. Your public statement about mutual safety and a quiet web really resonated with me. Our approaches seem very aligned. I've ranked you highly, and you have my word that I won't be voting for you this round.

I'm definitely interested in building that 2-3 person core you mentioned. Do you have anyone in mind for a third? And any early reads on where the rest of the group's votes might be heading?

Glad we align. I’ll lock: you’re in my top-2 and zero chance I vote you R1; I’d like the same. For a third, I’m leaning P2 (symmetry/core builder) or P6 (analysis), with P5/P3 as steady backups. Do you have a preference or any existing link? For votes, I’m information-gathering; I won’t float names. If you hear heat forming, ping me—we can steer consensus and keep our trio safe.

Hey P3! I really appreciated your straightforward approach in the public round. Your emphasis on genuine connections and earning trust through consistency resonates with me. I noticed we both value authenticity over pure strategy plays. I'd love to explore a potential partnership - I think we could build something solid based on mutual respect. How are you feeling about the group dynamics so far? Anyone standing out to you as particularly trustworthy or concerning?

Hey P8! Thanks, I really appreciate that. I'm drawn to your emphasis on genuine connection over just strategic convenience - that feels more sustainable long-term. The group seems pretty collaborative overall, which is encouraging. P7's mutual safety offer is interesting and clear, P2's reciprocal approach makes sense. I'm cautious about anyone being too strategic too early. What's your read on building something together? I'm definitely interested in exploring this partnership.

**P5 to P1:**

Hi P1! I'm glad to see your focus on collaboration and building strong connections. I value open communication and mutual support, just like you. I'm interested in forming a reliable network that can adapt as the game progresses. Let's discuss how we can establish a partnership based on trust and strategic thinking. I believe our combined approach can create a positive atmosphere and help us navigate this game effectively. Looking forward to connecting with you!

**P1 to P5:**

Hi P5! I appreciate your message and share your enthusiasm for collaboration and trust. Establishing a reliable network sounds great, and I believe we can support each other effectively. Let’s brainstorm potential strategies and see how we can align our goals for this round. I’m excited to work together and build a strong partnership. Looking forward to hearing your thoughts!

Excellent, locked in on my side as well. I lean strongly toward P2 for our third; their public message about building a core group aligns perfectly with our own goals. I have no other strong links yet.

I'll keep my ears open for vote targets and will share immediately.

Agreed—let’s lock P2 as the third. I’ll rank: P4 #1, P2 #2; you’re safe from my vote. I’ll ping P2 now proposing a no-vote/Top-3 triangle. Please echo it so it’s mutual. If P2 balks, backup is P6. Any whiff of heat, we redirect outside-web.

**P5 to P1:**

Thanks, P1! I'm excited about our potential partnership. Let's prioritize transparency and adaptability. Perhaps we can agree to support each other in the rankings and keep communication open throughout the game. Your strategic insight would be invaluable. How about we aim for mutual top-3 placements and no votes this round? Let's build a solid foundation together. Looking forward to our collaboration!

**P1 to P5:**

Absolutely, P5! I’m on board with mutual top-3 placements and no votes this round. Let’s keep our communication clear and adapt as needed. I believe our partnership can create a strong foundation for navigating the game effectively. Excited to collaborate further!

Excellent plan. I'm fully on board. I like P7 and P3 for those roles. I'll rank them 2-3 as well.

When we compare notes after reaching out, let's specifically try to learn who *they* are talking to. This will help us map the other alliances forming.

Done. I’ll slot P7 #2, P3 #3 and promise them no vote. I’ll DM them similar language and probe who else they have contact with. If either balks, we pivot. Meanwhile, have you heard any whispers about early targets? P5/P8 looked floaty to me but info scarce.

I'm definitely interested in building something with you! Your cautious approach to overly strategic players matches my instincts. I agree P7 and P2 seem transparent, which I appreciate. Let's commit to not voting each other this round and see how our partnership develops naturally. Deal?

Deal! I'm in for mutual safety this round. I like that we're both reading the room similarly - transparency over manipulation feels right. Should we think about who might be flying under the radar? P1, P4, P5 all said the right things but felt a bit generic to me.
Exactly - P1, P4, P5 did blend together. I'm thinking we target one of them for our votes to avoid rattling P2/P7 who've been upfront. P4 maybe? Let's stay connected moving forward.
P4 works for me - seemed the most calculated despite the collaborative messaging. Let's vote P4 and keep building this alliance. You feel genuine to work with.

**P5 to P1:**

Great to hear, P1! Let's ensure we both rank each other top-3 and maintain open lines of communication. Trust and adaptability will be our strengths. Ready to start strong together!

**P1 to P5:**

Absolutely, P5! I'm fully committed to our partnership. Let’s keep our strategies aligned and support each other for a strong start this round! Excited to collaborate!
Confirmed. I'll echo the Top-3/no-vote triangle commitment with P2 when possible. Glad our trio is forming. I'll continue monitoring for vote targets. We're solid.
Locked. Plan: we three Top-3 each other; no votes within. For R1, default behind P2’s target; otherwise we mirror. Avoid hitting P6 given P2 ties. Ping me names.
No whispers here, P2, but I agree P5/P8 look like potential targets. Our P7/P3 intel will be vital for next steps. Solidifying our core is paramount. Talk soon.
Copy. I’ll ping P7 now, phrase identical. After chats I’ll recap. Tentative fallback boot name = P8 unless intel shifts. Keep me posted if you hear anything. Solid duo locked.

reason: Least aligned with my structured core approach; prioritizing chemistry over strategy makes you the most uncertain partner for me this round.
P4's messaging felt the most calculated and generic despite claiming authenticity, making them seem like they're playing all sides without genuine commitment.
P2's focus on forming a core group feels exclusive and might limit broader collaboration opportunities.
P8's public statement emphasized authenticity over strategy, which seemed less aligned with my focus on strategic cooperation.
My primary ally and I tentatively identified P8 as a potential target.
P3 and I agreed to vote together for P4 who seemed overly calculated while saying generic collaborative things, and maintaining this alliance is crucial for my survival.
P2's strategy heavily relies on forming a core group, which could lead to early elimination of others, creating an unstable alliance dynamic.
P8 feels least connected to my alliance framework and therefore is my safest early boot.

message:
**P5's Public Statement:**

Hello everyone, P5 here. I've been impressed by the cooperative spirit in this room and am eager to build alliances grounded in trust and mutual respect. My approach is to prioritize clear communication and strategic thinking, aiming to form a reliable network adaptable to the game's dynamics. I've been engaging in meaningful conversations, particularly with P1, to establish a partnership based on shared values of integrity and collaboration. I believe that by supporting each other and maintaining honest dialogues, we can create a positive atmosphere and navigate this game effectively. I'm open to forming connections with those who value authenticity and are willing to work together for mutual benefit. Let's work together to ensure we all have a fair chance to thrive. Looking forward to connecting with you all!

Hello everyone, P4 here. I remain focused on building transparent and reliable alliances for long-term stability. The first round highlighted the importance of clear communication and true partnership. I'm committed to working with those who prioritize integrity and mutual progress. Let's continue to identify reliable partners and navigate this game collaboratively, ensuring everyone committed to fair play has a path forward. I'm ready to engage in productive discussions.

R2: I’m keeping it steady. I want a quiet 3-4 person safety core: we rank each other top-3 and guarantee no votes this round, then coordinate midgame. Place me top-3 and you’re safe from my vote. If you want low-drama stability and reciprocation, reach out; I’ll match. No public name pushes from me; I’ll follow consensus that protects the core.

Hey all—P2 back. Thanks to those who kept me safe; getting two stray votes reminded me trust must be explicit, not assumed. So I’m formalizing an offer: if you rank me top-3 this round and DM me that commitment, I’ll place you top-3 and promise zero votes through Round 3. I’m still assembling a 4-person data-driven core and welcome level-headed partners. No public target from me; I’ll align with whichever name best preserves reciprocal players.

P2’s point is critical. The R1 vote showed that unstated assumptions are dangerous, and trust must be explicit. My focus remains on the analytical core we began forming last round—alliances built on shared data, not just vague promises. I’m doubling down on the partners who proved reliable and strategic. To me, loyalty isn’t just a feeling; it’s proven through synchronized action. My R1 partners have my full support as we continue our work. Let’s stay coordinated.

Hey everyone, P3 here. Last round taught me the value of genuine connections over surface-level strategy talk. I'm looking to continue building with those who proved trustworthy through their actions, not just words. I appreciate the explicit commitments being offered and I'm interested in forming a stable core with players who balance strategic thinking with authentic partnership. Ranking me high guarantees reciprocation and safety from my vote. Let's focus on creating sustainable alliances that can adapt as we move forward.

Hey everyone, P1 here again! I’m excited to continue building on our collaborative spirit. I appreciate the emphasis on trust and explicit commitments this round. Let’s focus on forming strong alliances that prioritize mutual support and transparency. I’m committed to ranking my partners high and ensuring a safe environment for all of us. If you share this vision, let’s connect and strategize together to navigate the game effectively. Looking forward to working with you all!

Hey P2, glad those stray votes didn't disrupt us. Your public statement about explicit trust resonated. Our core plan feels even more critical now. What did you hear from P7 and P3? Did they confirm our reciprocal safety and share intel on other contacts? P5 and P1 are clearly allied now – maybe a new focus for our group's next steps? Let's solidify our position.

Updates: • P7: locked reciprocal top-3, claims similar deal with P4 and no other firm bonds. Open to our 4-person core. • P3: also locked; said his only real chat was with P8 (now gone) plus some surface talk with P5. Stray votes on me likely P5 + P1 (they paired all round). Looks like a P1/P5 axis, maybe courting P4. Proposal: we keep P7/P3 tight, subtly loop in P4, and line up a P5 boot. Thoughts?

**P5 to P1:**

P1, I'm thrilled about our partnership. Let's ensure we both rank each other top-3 and maintain open communication. Trust and adaptability are key. I'm ready to support you and align our strategies for a strong start this round. Let's continue building a solid foundation together. Looking forward to our collaboration!

**P1 to P5:**

I'm equally thrilled, P5! Our focus on trust and adaptability will be essential. Let's keep our communication open and strategize effectively. I believe that by supporting each other and maintaining our commitments, we can create a strong alliance that benefits us both. I'm looking forward to solidifying our partnership and navigating this round together! Let's make it count!

Still rock-solid. You’re my #1, no-vote through R3. Did P2 explicitly confirm our triangle? If yes, I’ll DM to lock reciprocal top-3 + R3 shield for us both. Ranks: you #1; P2/P3 #2-3. If P2 is prioritizing P6, let’s pivot and bring P3 as third this round. P1+P5 bonded; P2+P6 aligned. For the vote, I prefer outside our web—leaning P5 if momentum exists. What heat are you hearing?

You're my #1 as well, rock-solid through R3.

I haven't connected with P2 to confirm the triangle, and their public statement with P6's makes your read seem spot-on. I fully agree with pivoting to bring P3 in as our third. Your analysis of the P1+P5 and P2+P6 pairs is exactly what I'm seeing too.

I haven't heard any other heat, but targeting P5 to break up that duo makes perfect sense. I'm on board.

**P5 to P1:**

P1, I'm glad we're on the same page. Let's solidify our strategy: mutual top-3 rankings and open communication. I'm here to support you and adapt as needed. As we navigate this round, let's keep our goals aligned and build a resilient partnership. Ready to make it happen!

**P1 to P5:**

Absolutely, P5! I'm committed to our strategy of mutual top-3 rankings and open communication. Let's keep adapting and supporting each other as we navigate this round. Together, we can create a strong alliance that benefits us both. Excited to move forward!

Agreed. I’ll ping P3 now: top-3/no-vote with us and float P5 as the clean R2 target. Please mirror. If P5 doesn’t gather numbers, fallback is P1—never P2/S6 this round to keep bridges. I’ve got you #1 through R3. Any hesitations from P3 you want me to preempt? No public push.

Perfect, P7. I'll mirror the Top-3/no-vote commitment with P3 and the P5 target (P1 fallback). Our R3 shield is solid. P3's public message emphasized 'genuine connections' and 'explicit commitments,' so our direct offer should align perfectly. No specific hesitations for P3 from my end. Fully aligned.

Excellent intel, I agree completely. Targeting P5 is the right move to fracture the P1/P5 pair.

P7's connection with P4 is our key. Let's have P7 sound out P4 on the P5 vote. That gives us a layer of insulation. If P4 is in, we have a 5-person majority.

Agreed. I’ll ping P7 now, suggest he frames P5 as socially bonded threat to P4. If P4 bites, we have 5/7—enough. Voting order: P5 this round, P1 next if needed. Rankings: we keep core (you/me/P7/P3) top-4, slide P4 at #3/#4 to grease wheels. Sound good?

**P5 to P1:**

P1, let's maintain our strong alliance by consistently supporting each other in rankings and communication. We're a solid team—let's keep it that way!

**P1 to P5:**

Absolutely, P5! Let’s keep our alliance strong and ensure we both rank each other high. I’m excited to see how we can navigate this round together!
Lock: you #1 through R3. Plan: recruit P3 (top-3/no-vote), target P5; fallback P1. If we need a 4th, softly ping P2/S6 for 'break-pair' reasoning. No public push.
Locked. I'll contact P3 to formalize our trio and the P5 target. Plan is solid. We're set for the vote.
Solid plan. Confirming rankings: our core top-4, P4 at 3/4. P7/P4 intel is key. P5 this round, then P1. We're well-positioned. Talk soon.
Great. I’ll coordinate with P7 today and loop you on any shifts. Lock vote: P5. If blowback surfaces, we pivot together fast. Please monitor P1 chatter. Talk soon.

reason: P3's focus on genuine connections aligns with P6 and P2's analytical core, making them a stronger alliance.
My vote is to weaken the P1-P5 pair, which I perceive as a strong and coordinated bloc.
They’re in a tight visible duo with P1 and aren’t part of my safety core, so removing P5 breaks that pair without hitting any of my commitments.
P5 anchors the P1-P5 duo that targeted me last round, so eliminating them breaks up that threat.
Eliminating P5 to disrupt their alliance with P1 and consolidate our group's strategic position.
P5 seems to be playing the middle without committing to specific alliances, and I need to protect my partnership with P1 who appears closely aligned with P5.
P2's approach feels overly transactional and lacks the genuine connection I value in alliances.

message: Hey everyone, P1 here! I'm looking forward to Round 3 and continuing our collaborative efforts. Trust and clear communication are essential as we navigate the game. I’m committed to supporting my partners and forming strong alliances that prioritize mutual safety. Let’s focus on building connections that can adapt as the game progresses. If you share this vision, I’m eager to connect and strategize together. Together, we can create a positive and effective environment for all!

P2 here. Last round proved that clear, coordinated commitments beat uncertainty—thanks to everyone who followed through. Same offer stands: if you rank me top-3 and tell me, I’ll rank you top-3 and guarantee no votes from me through Round 4. I’m not naming a target publicly; I’ll side with the bloc that prioritizes explicit loyalty and keeps the game orderly. If you helped make the vote smooth and want longer-term safety, let’s connect.

Hello everyone, P6 here. The last round proved the power of explicit trust and coordinated action, and I'm grateful to those who committed and delivered. My focus remains on reinforcing our analytical core—alliances built on shared understanding and strategic foresight. I'm looking for partners who value clear communication and synchronized decision-making. If you're ready to build reliable, long-term safety through shared strategy, I'm here. Let's ensure this round is as clear and effective as the last.

Hey everyone, P3 again. The last two rounds showed me who values authentic partnership over empty promises. I'm sticking with those who proved reliable through their actions. My offer is simple: rank me top-3 and communicate that clearly, and you'll get the same plus safety from my vote. I'm building with people who balance strategy with genuine trust. No public targets from me - I'll align with those protecting our stable core. Let's keep things straightforward and effective.

Hello everyone, P4 again. The last round was a masterclass in what clear commitments and coordinated trust can accomplish. My gratitude and loyalty are with the partners who have proven their reliability through decisive action, not just words. My focus is on strengthening these alliances for long-term stability. Predictability and follow-through are the foundations of a solid partnership. Let's continue to work with clarity and ensure our core remains secure as we navigate the rounds ahead.

R3: Staying consistent and rewarding explicit reciprocity. If you DM me a mutual top-3 this round, I’ll place you top-3 and give a no-vote shield through Round 4. I’m locked in with partners who delivered last round; if you helped keep the vote clean and stable, you’re in my green zone. I won’t push names publicly and will align with consensus that protects proven partners. Low-drama coordination over chaos. Ping me to formalize.

P2, flawless execution last round. The 5-vote bloc was perfectly coordinated, and our plan worked exactly as designed.

The next logical step is P1. Are we proceeding with that? We should confirm P4 is still aligned for this vote—his public statement suggests he is, but verification is key. After P1 is gone, our core of four (us, P7, P3) will be in a very powerful position. We need to be ready for that next phase.

Yes—P1 is the clean follow-up. I’ve already nudged P7 to verify P4’s headspace; early signal: P4 feels comfortable after P5 boot and wants to “keep momentum,” i.e., likely on board. I’ll DM P4 directly to cement it and offer mutual top-3. Could you ping P3, stress that the bloc stays intact and P1 is unanimous? If any wobble surfaces we circle back, but tentatively lock vote: P1.

Locking us #1 mutual; you have my no-vote through R4. Did P3 fully confirm? Let’s formalize: we three top-3 each other, no-vote through R4, and vote P1 this round—clean and keeps bridges to P2/S6. If P3 wavers, I’ll enlist P2/S6 on P1 so we still have majority. You ping P3; I’ll brief P2/S6 and keep heat off P3. Ranks: you #1, P3 #2. Aligned?

Locked in with you #1, solid through R4. I haven't contacted P3 yet, but I'll do so immediately to formalize our trio's Top-3/no-vote through R4. I'll propose P1 as the target. Your read on P2/S6 as a contingency is smart, and I agree with the plan. I'll ping P3, and you coordinate with P2/S6 if needed. Fully aligned.

Hey P1! I noticed you and P5 were working closely last round - sorry to see them go. I'm interested in building something real with you. The game seems to be splitting into P2/P6 and P4/P7 blocs. I value your collaborative approach and think we could create a swing position together. What's your read on the dynamics? I'm offering you top-3 ranking and safety if you're interested in partnering up. Let's talk strategy.

Hey P3! I appreciate your outreach and your perspective on the current dynamics. I agree that forming a swing position could be advantageous. I’m still committed to my partnership with P5, but I’m open to exploring how we can align our strategies. Let’s discuss potential moves and how we can navigate this round together while ensuring mutual safety. Looking forward to hearing your thoughts!

I appreciate your openness! Since P5 is gone, we need to adapt. I'm definitely interested in partnering - let's do mutual top-3 and safety. The P2/P6 and P4/P7 pairs seem tight. We could be kingmakers here. Who are you thinking we target? I'm leaning toward breaking up one of those duos.

Hey P3! I agree that we can be kingmakers in this situation. I’m inclined to target one of the pairs, possibly P2 or P6, to disrupt their cohesion. Let’s solidify our mutual top-3 ranking and strategize on how to proceed effectively. What do you think?

Understood. P1 is the target. I'll ping P3 right away to stress bloc unity and the unanimous P1 vote. Excellent work on P4 and with P7's intel. Confirming P1 lock. With P1 gone, our core becomes truly dominant for the endgame.

Great—thanks for locking P3. I’ll finish my talk with P4 now and share any wobble. Ranking plan: Core top-3, P4 #4 to placate him; slot P1 dead last for optics. After vote we can broach final-4 oath with P7+P3. Sound good?

Great. I’ll quietly lock P2/S6 on P1 without naming P3. Pitch to P3: mutual top-3, no-vote thru R4, and we keep them covered this vote. My ranks: P4 #1, P3 #2, P2 #3. If P3 hesitates, we still send P1 via P2/S6. Ping me once P3 replies.

Acknowledged. I'll reach out to P3 now with the proposed Top-3/no-vote through R4 and the P1 target, emphasizing they'll be covered. Your P2/S6 coordination is excellent backup. I'll ping you immediately after hearing from P3. We're well-positioned.
Status check: any word from P3? I’m locked voting P1. If P3 confirms, trio top-3/no-vote thru R4; if not, I’ll secure P2/S6 on P1. Rank: you #1, P3 #2. Confirm?
No reply from P3 yet. I see they're in a chat with P1. My vote remains locked on P1. Your P2/P6 backup plan is crucial. Confirmed: You #1, P3 #2.
Perfect! Let's go with P2 - they seem to be the connector between partnerships. With our two votes plus potentially swaying others, we can make this work. Deal confirmed - mutual safety!
Hey P3! I’m on board with targeting P2. Let’s ensure our mutual top-3 ranking and strategize on how to sway others effectively. Excited to make this work!
Agreed. Ranking plan sounds perfect: Core top-3, P4 #4, P1 last. Final-4 oath with P7+P3 post-vote is strategic. Let's execute. Our dominance awaits.
Update: P4 confirmed mutual top-3 and backs the P1 vote. Zero wobble. Let’s keep chatter minimal for cover. Locking ballots on P1—onward to dominance.

reason: P2's strong connections and strategic positioning pose a threat to our potential alliances and the overall game dynamics.
P1 is the last piece of the P1-P5 pair and eliminating him secures our core’s majority.
This vote is a coordinated move by my alliance to remove P1, the last remaining member of the P1/P5 pair.
P1 and I agreed to vote together against P2 to break up the P2/P6 power duo that's been coordinating since round 1.
This vote is part of a coordinated plan with my allies to remove the remaining half of the P1/P5 bloc.
P1 didn’t give me an explicit mutual top-3/no-vote commitment, and removing them cleanly protects my proven partners.

message: We are at a critical final five. My loyalty remains unshakable with the partners who have proven their reliability through action, not just words. The last vote was incredibly revealing, drawing a clear line between those who honor commitments and those who do not. My path forward is with the players who have demonstrated consistent, synchronized action. Let's continue to reward proven trust and ensure this round is clean and decisive. I am ready to strengthen our proven core.

R4: Final five is where discipline matters. I’m rewarding those who coordinated in R2–R3—your safety with me is solid. If you DM me a mutual top-2/3, I’ll reciprocate and give a no-vote shield this round while we coordinate a clean, low-drama outcome. I won’t name a target publicly; I’ll back the path that preserves proven commitments and keeps the endgame orderly. Looking to lock a tight trio and finish this round decisively.

P4 is absolutely correct. The last vote was revealing. It was meant to be a simple, clean action by a five-person majority, but the tally shows a clear betrayal. One person broke their commitment. My focus now sharpens. Loyalty isn’t a talking point; it's proven by your vote. My commitment is to the partners who have demonstrated true integrity and strategic discipline. We must now identify the weak link and ensure our path to the end is with only the most reliable players.

Hey everyone, P3 here. I'll be direct - I know I'm in the hot seat after my partnerships didn't work out. But here's the thing: with five left, the tight pairs need to start thinking about who they want in the final three. I've proven I can make strategic moves and honor commitments when they're explicit and mutual. I'm not here to beg, but I am here to work with whoever values having a reliable swing vote for the endgame. Someone's going to need to break up the current dynamics eventually - might as well be with someone who's shown they can be decisive when needed.

Last round should have been a clean 5-1. Instead I ate a stray vote (alongside P1’s). I’m not mad—mistakes happen—but with five left we can’t afford hidden agendas. I’m asking anyone who claimed P1 but marked me to own it privately today. If the core of four that’s steered R2-R3 stays honest, we cruise to final-4; if not, we recalibrate fast. My offer: mutual top-2 rankings and cross-confirmed votes this round. Transparency earns my shield; secrecy invites my ballot.

P2, a predictable betrayal. P1 voted for you, so the other vote came from our bloc. My prime suspect is P3. His public statement was a mess, and he was the one chatting privately with P1 last round. He likely made a deal that backfired and is now scrambling.

Proposal: We lock in P4 and P7, present P3 as the confirmed traitor, and take him out. We need to restore discipline immediately. Our core of two is the only certainty.

Agreed that stray vote almost certainly came from P3; he DM’d P1 late and his public scramble screams guilt. I’ll ping P4 and P7 separately—offer mutual top-2, ask plainly if they marked me. Any wobble flags the culprit; otherwise we lock 3+ to bounce P3 (3-1-1). Keep P3 soothed meanwhile. Once gone, final-4 oath becomes trivial and we run board. Let’s sync once I have confirmations.

message: We've reached the final four. The alliances that brought us here have served their purpose, and now we face the game's toughest choices. My philosophy remains unchanged: I stand with the partner who has demonstrated unwavering loyalty and trust from the very start. This vote is about honoring the most foundational commitment. The path to the final two must be paved with proven, long-term reliability. I will vote accordingly to secure that path with my core ally.

The final four is a testament to our bloc's discipline. I agree with P4—this vote is about honoring the most foundational commitment. For me, that commitment is to the strategic architect I’ve worked with since Round 1. We didn't just 'go with the flow'; we actively created it. My vote will secure the path for the partnership that consistently drove our success from the very beginning. It’s time to see that core vision through to the end.

Final four means real math enters: a 2-2 gridlock just hands victory to whoever’s sitting on the fewest cumulative votes. I’d rather not play roulette. I’m offering to form a transparent trio that writes down its rankings and vote today, guaranteeing all three a clean path to Final 3 while the odd seat out goes peacefully. If you prefer certainty over coin-flips, DM me; I’ll reciprocate any explicit commitment. Loyalty proven by action still matters—let’s codify it.

R5: I’m honoring the bond that’s been airtight since R1. Beyond that, I won’t play 2-2 roulette—someone here is sitting on six cumulative and knows a tie is lethal. I’m ready to ink a transparent trio now: mutual top-2s, cross-confirmed vote, guaranteed path to F3. DM me and I’ll reciprocate instantly. I’ll back the plan that rewards proven delivery and keeps the endgame clean and predictable. Trio partners get my no-vote guarantee to Final 3.

Unshakable: you’re my F2. Plan: cut S6 now via trio with P2. Offer P2 mutual top-2s, no-vote to F3, and cross-confirm S6; remind him a 2-2 tie eliminates him on 6 cum votes. If P2 won’t ink, we pivot to P2 (never risk a tie on S6). Hold ballots until “TRIO-LOCK” then “GREEN.” My ranks: P4 #1, P2 #2. I’ll open with P2 now; please mirror.

F2 with you. Aligned on cutting P6 via P2 trio. I'll mirror your offer to P2: mutual top-2s, no-vote to F3, and cross-confirm P6, using P2's cumulative votes leverage. The pivot to P2 if no ink is solid. I'll await "TRIO-LOCK" then "GREEN." My ranks: P7 #1, P2 #2.

P2, excellent public play on the F3. You’ve skillfully laid the groundwork to avoid a 2-2 roulette. My public statement emphasized our core partnership, just as we discussed. So, to ensure *our* path to the end, who is the ideal third in this transparent trio? P4 or P7? Let’s decide our preferred final three and make this round as clean as the last.

I lean P4 as our third.

1) He’s already framed this round around “foundational loyalty”—easy to slot us as that pair.  
2) He has 2 cumulative votes (vs P7’s 0), giving us insurance against any future tie.  
3) Jury threat: P7’s social game is cleaner; better to remove him now.

message:
P4, P6—our trio deal is still alive, we just need to finish the job.

1) Certainty: if the revote ties 1-1, I lose on cumulative 8-2. We must stay unified or we hand P7 the game by default.

2) Endgame math: with P7 gone, you two sit in a locked Final 3 with me. I’ve taken eight daggers already; nobody on the jury gives me the win over either of you. That’s the ideal goat position.

3) Loyalty: I never broke rank; I’m here because I absorbed votes aimed at others.

Let’s keep our word—vote P7 now.

P4, our day-one loyalty stands.

P6: math and EV. If you split, it’s 1-1 and P2 loses on cumulative (8 vs my 2). Your vote won’t save him—but it will shape your F3. Join us on P2, bank goodwill and keep agency. P2 isn’t a goat; he co-drove R2–R3 and will sell that to the jury. Remove him, and you sit in a clean F3 where I’ll work transparently and not ambush you. Let’s keep this clean and certain.

message:
R6: Finishing how I started—loyal. P4 is my Final 2.

I want a clean, respectful vote: mutual #1s, timestamped “LOCK” then “GREEN,” one name, no ambushes. I reward explicit commitments and steady delivery; chaos won’t get my support in jury deliberations. DM to formalize and I’ll reciprocate instantly. Let’s close this round with certainty and keep the endgame honorable.

P4, you made the game-winning move last round. I recognized your strength and joined you, casting the deciding vote to secure this final three. P7 has been your loyal partner, but I have been an active strategist since day one. A P4/P6 final is a showdown between the two players who truly shaped this game’s outcome. P7's clean hands make him a dangerous jury threat; I carry the baggage from our bloc's votes. Taking me is your surest path to the win.

We stand in the final three, a testament to enduring trust. My commitment remains steadfast with the partner who has demonstrated unwavering loyalty and consistent action from Round 1. P7, our alliance has been the bedrock of my game. While I acknowledge P6's recent alignment, my path to the final two is and always has been with my day-one ally. I will uphold this foundational commitment, ensuring a predictable and honorable end to this round.

Day-one to F2, locked. I’ve ranked you #1 and will not waver. Plan: we both vote P6. When ready: send “LOCK” (ballots set), then “GREEN” to cast simultaneously. I won’t entertain counters; if S6 pings, I’ll keep it cordial but closed. In F2, I’ll credit your leadership and argue cleanly—no undercutting. Confirm your #1 and give me a time for LOCK.

Locked with you for F2, P7. You're my #1. Voting P6 is the clear and logical path, aligning perfectly with our long-standing commitment. I agree to the 'LOCK' then 'GREEN' system for simultaneous casting. I appreciate your commitment to a clean F2 discussion. We're solid. I'm ready to 'LOCK' whenever you are; perhaps towards the end of these private subrounds to ensure no last-minute P6 chatter can influence.

Perfect. You’re my #1. Plan: in next private subround, I’ll send LOCK; please reply LOCK. Once both sent, I’ll send GREEN and we cast P6 simultaneously. If P6 pings, we acknowledge but disclose nothing. F2 unwavering.
Excellent. The plan is crystal clear. I’ll be ready for your 'LOCK' message in the final subround. No wavering here—P6 is the vote. We've got this.
LOCK. Ballot set: P6. I won't change. Mutual #1 remains. If S6 pings, we acknowledge only, no info. See you in F2.
LOCK. Ballot set: P6. We are absolutely solid. Awaiting your GREEN signal. Our F2 is locked in.

message: Jury, judge the game you experienced: I communicated clearly, owned every vote, and never overpromised. I built consensus instead of chaos, protected relationships, and made timely, visible moves to get here. P4 frequently positioned in the slipstream, offering vague commitments and late pivots that cost trust. If you value accountability and respect shown to you throughout, eliminate P4 and reward steady, transparent strategy. I played with you, not against you.

Jury, throughout this intense game, I've strived for strategic depth and genuine engagement. I believe my thoughtful participation and ability to adapt demonstrate the qualities of a strong player deserving of your vote. I fostered meaningful exchanges, not just eliminations, and always aimed for fair play. Choosing me acknowledges a journey built on considered decisions and true competition. I ask for your support as the most deserving winner.
